org.obapanel.jedis.cache.simple

Class SimpleCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.obapanel.jedis.cache.simple.SimpleCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>, Listable<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>, Mapeable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>

    public class SimpleCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>, Listable<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>>, Mapeable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>
    A cache is a Map-like data structure that provides temporary storage of application data. This cache stores all his data in a Redis server, and all the operations are done remotely on redis. NO cache data is stored inside the class Like maps, a cache store key-value pairs and its iterable Keys inside redis are resolved with the cache name to avoid duplication in redis space Unlike maps, null keys or values aren't allowed. Every value has a timeout before it's deleted automatically by redis You can use a CacheLoader to give read-through caching, that is the ability to search externally for a value not present in the cache You can use a CacheWriter to give write-through caching, that is the ability to insert/update or delete a value when it's modified in the cache This cache works like a javax.cache.Cache but simpler and fewer options (no factories, events, mxbeans, statistics included) The cache must have a Jedis connection pool Also a name, every instance with the same name will access the same redis data And a timeout that will be applied to all data by default

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> asList()
      Return all the current key-value pairs in the cache into a local unmodifiable entry list This will make N access to redis and make a copy of the remote data
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> asMap()
      Return all the current key-value pairs in the cache into a local unmodifiable map This will make N access to redis and make a copy of the remote data
      void clear()
      Will remove ALL entries from redis It will not affect external values
      void close()
      Close this instance of redis cache Does not affect redis of extenal data
      boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
      Checks if a key exists in redis
      java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key)
      Gets current value from redis cache read-through: If not found, it can use the default cacheloader if present
      java.lang.String get(java.lang.String key, CacheLoader cacheLoader)
      Gets current value from redis cache read-through: If not found, it can use the provided cacheloader The default cacheloader is overridden
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAll(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys)
      Gets values from redis cache read-through: If not found, it can use the default cacheloader if present Not found values will not be present in result map (null resutls are no retunred)
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAll(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys, CacheLoader cacheLoader)
      Gets values from redis cache If not found, it can use the given cacheloader The default cacheloader is overridden Not found values will not be present in result map (null results are no retunned)
      java.lang.String getAndPut(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Inserts a new value for given key in redis The new value will use the default timeout of the cache If the value exists it will be returned in this method (and overwritten) write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, it will be updated in external sources
      java.lang.String getAndRemove(java.lang.String key)
      Removes for given key in redis and returns the current redis value write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, it will be removed in external sources
      java.lang.String getAndReplace(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Will return the current value for a specified key, and replace it with the given new value If not value is present in redis cache, no operation will be done This is equivalent to if cache.containsKey(key) { V oldValue = cache.get(key) cache.put(key, value) return oldValue } else { return null } write-through: If the value is going to be updated in redis, in external system too
      java.lang.String getName()
      Current name
      boolean isClosed()
      Check if closed
      CacheIterator iterator()
      Return an iterator for current key-value pairs Until hasNext / next is called, no data is retrieved from redis

      Return all the current keys in the cache into a local unmodifiable list
      CacheKeyIterator keysIterator()
      Return an iterator for current keys Until hasNext / next is called, no data is retrieved from redis
      void loadAll(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys, boolean replaceExistingValues)
      Load the set of keys from external sources, updating their values in redis If no cacheLoader exists, it does nothing read-through: resolves data from external source if possible
      void put(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Inserts a new value for given key in redis The new value will use the default timeout of the cache If the value exists, it will be overwritten write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, it will be updated in external sources
      void put(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value, long timeOutMs)
      Inserts a new value for given key in redis The new value will use given timeout If the value exists, it will be overwritten write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, it will be updated in external sources
      void putAll(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> values)
      Inserts a list of new key-values in cache The new values will use the default timeout of the cache If any value exists, it will be overwritten write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, it will be updated in external sources
      boolean putIfAbsent(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Inserts a new value for given key in redis if no previous value is present Nothing will be done otherwise The new value will use given timeout write-through: If a cacheWriter is present and can be updated in redis, it will be updated in external sources
      boolean remove(java.lang.String key)
      Removes for given key in redis If the value doesn't exist, nothing will happen write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, it will be removed in external sources
      boolean remove(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String oldValue)
      Removes for given key in redis if the value matches The deletion will happen if current value matches with given value write-through: If a cacheWriter is present and the deletion is done, it will be removed in external sources
      void removeAll()
      Will remove ALL entries from redis write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, all external values wil be deleted
      void removeAll(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys)
      Will remove entries from redis with the given keys write-through: If a cacheWriter is present, all external values wil be deleted
      boolean replace(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Replaces key value with new value if key exists write-through: If value is replaced and a cachewriter exits, external source is updated too
      boolean replace(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String oldValue, java.lang.String newValue)
      Replaces key value with new value if current redis value is equals to given oldValue write-through: If value is replaced and a cachewriter exits, external source is updated too
      java.lang.String resolveKey(java.lang.String key)
      Converts the key from external representation to internal (redis) one No null accepted

      • remove

        public boolean remove(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String oldValue)
        Removes for given key in redis if the value matches The deletion will happen if current value matches with given value write-through: If a cacheWriter is present and the deletion is done, it will be removed in external sources
        Parameters:
        key - Key of the value
        oldValue - value that must equal to redis one to execute deletion
        Returns:
        true if deleted

      • replace

        public boolean replace(java.lang.String key,
                       java.lang.String oldValue,
                       java.lang.String newValue)
        Replaces key value with new value if current redis value is equals to given oldValue write-through: If value is replaced and a cachewriter exits, external source is updated too
        Parameters:
        key - Key to have replacement
        oldValue - Value to be matched
        newValue - New value to update in redis
        Returns:
        true if replaced

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getAndReplace

        public java.lang.String getAndReplace(java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.String value)
        Will return the current value for a specified key, and replace it with the given new value If not value is present in redis cache, no operation will be done This is equivalent to if cache.containsKey(key) { V oldValue = cache.get(key) cache.put(key, value) return oldValue } else { return null } write-through: If the value is going to be updated in redis, in external system too
        Parameters:
        key - Key to be modified
        value - New value to be updated
        Returns:
        Old value in cache

        Parameters:
        keys - keys to remove
